text: Just got my local dev environment set up and syncing with my Portal using `watch` (shout out to the HubSpot dev team for making this happen!) - curious what solution everyone is using for development testing - is the Java server still the way to do this? (reference: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-hubl-server>)...... is anyone syncing files to a developer sandbox and testing that way?

I, along with a few others in this thread have mentioned getting the cli tool with the local server, but alas I haven't gotten that far. What most folks are doing is setting up a sandbox portal as a dev portal, testing there, then pushing to the production portal
It isn't flawless, but it kinda works. doesn't give you that fast hot reloading when your cranking out minor css changes to dial things in.
check that. they're using github actions to push to prod when commiting to master branch. I've been using this and it works pretty well
